history: Yoo-Sin is named after General Kim Yoo Sin, a commanding general during the Silla Dynasty. The sixty-eight movements refer to the last two figures of the year six-hundred-sixty-eight A.D., the year Korea was united. The ready posture signifies a sword drawn on the right rather than left side, symbolizing Yoo Sin's mistake of following his Kings' orders to fight with foreign forces against his own nation.
